name: sentiently
content:

in a way that shows that someone or something is conscious and able to experience feelings: We are reaching a point where computers and robots will be able to exist sentiently and be indistinguishable from humans. Scientists find that plants behave somewhat sentiently by seeking out conditions that suit their needs.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is sometimes easy to forget that the strangers we interact with on the internet are the same people who sentiently walk among us in real life. They sentiently set in motion a scheme that was designed to interfere with the judicial process.
